## I. Reading Seurat object

First step is to read the Seurat objects, previously created

```{r}
message("Loading Seurat object...")
data.seurat <- readRDS(input_seurat_object)

# Filter only CTRL cells
#data.seurat <- data.seurat[,data.seurat$orig.ident == "Pan_neuro_control"]

```

# Compute correlation across all gene expression

```{r}
# Prepare
data.regulons <- data.seurat@meta.data
regulon.names <- names(data.regulons)
regulon.names <- regulon.names[startsWith(regulon.names, prefix = "SCENIC") & endsWith(regulon.names, suffix = "regulon")]
data.regulons <- data.regulons[regulon.names]
correlation_data <- data.frame(regulon = regulon.names, gene = NA, cor = NA, p = NA, r2 = NA)
rownames(correlation_data) <- correlation_data$regulon

# Initialize progress bar
num_regulons <- length(regulon.names)
pb <- txtProgressBar(min = 0, max = num_regulons, style = 3)

# Go through all genes
for(i in 1:num_regulons){
  regulon <- regulon.names[i]
  
  # Calculate correlation, p-value, and RÂ²
  cor_test <- suppressWarnings(cor.test(data.regulons[[regulon]], data.seurat$AUC_OXPHOS_68_Porcelli, method = "pearson"))
  correlation_data[regulon, "cor"] <- cor_test$estimate
  correlation_data[regulon, "p"] <- cor_test$p.value
  correlation_data[regulon, "r2"] <- cor_test$estimate^2
  correlation_data[regulon, "gene"] <- gsub(x = gsub(x = regulon, pattern = "_activating_regulon", replacement = ""), pattern = "SCENIC_", replacement = "")
  
  # Update progress bar
  setTxtProgressBar(pb, i)
}
correlation_data <- correlation_data[-1,]

# Close progress bar
close(pb)

# Sort by correlation
correlation_data <- correlation_data[order(correlation_data$cor, decreasing = T),]
correlation_data
```
